column4: I think it burned ok. I can, of course, try to check it to be sure...

actually, even the "disk-check" (or disk-test) item on the menu doesn't work - it brings a "kernel...... something test something" command, blinks the LED on the DVD for a while and drops me into the boot menu again.
Would it make sense to try burning the disk again or is there anything else to try?
Westerners always think I am. But in the sad, boring reality Danila is just a traditional male name in Russia. :-(
I would try to burn the CD again. Mabye at slower speed. The first ubuntu CD I burned didn't work
I don't know if this helps, but you can install ubuntu first and then enable the network to upgrade/download/install suff

Well, sadly this doesn't seem very helpful... :) I mean, I don't think upgrading a fresh LiveCD would help much. It's probably the old "Unix being picky about who it is friendly with". Nothing ever works for me correctly...
that's not what I meant. =) try to install it without the network first, then setup the network
Do you mean install completely without network support? I really wanted to see if I'd like Ubuntu using the LiveCD. To install I'd need to resize partitions and that would take too much time...
sorry my bad... I thought you meant the installer CD
it's ok. But do you have any idea what could be causing the problem? (after setting up Networking preferences for the first time all applications stop launching)
I have no idea.. Does your PC work proppery with another LiveCD like Knoppix ?
You mean on your PC or in general?
Or may be it's just that I was too stupid to find out how to set it up there. On my PC I couldn't make Knoppix to work with Internet.
Ubuntu, on the other hand, works (albeit the speed is apparently quite slow - subjectively).
Knoppix works fine on the internet for me, but I need to modprobe my network card first
